edu.rit.pj2.tracker

Class JobSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.tracker.Sender
      • edu.rit.pj2.tracker.JobSender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JobRef

    public class JobSender
extends Sender
implements JobRef
    Class JobSender provides an object for sending messages to a Job. A job sender must be attached to a Proxy before the job sender can be used.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JobSender()
      Construct a new job sender.

      • taskLaunching

        public void taskLaunching(long taskID,
                 int[] devnum,
                 boolean runInJobProcess)
                   throws IOException
        Tell this job that the given task is launching.
        Specified by:
        taskLaunching in interface JobRef
        Parameters:
        taskID - Task ID.
        devnum - Array of GPU device numbers the task is allowed to use (must be non-null).
        runInJobProcess - True to run the task in the job's process, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • takeTuple

        public void takeTuple(long taskID,
             long requestID,
             Tuple template,
             boolean blocking,
             boolean taking)
               throws IOException
        Tell this job to take a tuple that matches the given template out of tuple space.
        Specified by:
        takeTuple in interface JobRef
        Parameters:
        taskID - Task ID.
        requestID - Request ID.
        template - Template.
        blocking - True for a blocking take or read, false for a non-blocking take or read.
        taking - True to take a tuple, false to read a tuple.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • jobFailed

        public void jobFailed(Throwable exc)
        Tell this job that the whole job failed.

        Note: This method does not do a remote invocation.

        Specified by:
        jobFailed in interface JobRef
        Parameters:
        exc - Exception that was thrown.
